More detail in README.

Add JdbcSchema.create, more user-friendly way to create schemas on a JDBC back-end.

Disable eigenbase tests (even though most work).

Implement COUNT in Java using linq4j longCount method (gives long result needed). Implement MIN and MAX.
Progress on TableFunctions.
Initial commit
Progress on TableFunctions with parameters.
Implement views; work in progress.
Make it easier to create a MapSchema or ReflectiveSchema with a valid expression.
Re-organize test suite.
Move tests to src/test/java tree.
Remove eigenbase-properties source code (package org.eigenbase.util.property).
Complete refactoring to use QueryableRecorder.
QueryableRecorder method definitions are now complete.
Implementing methods in QueryableRecorder (work in progress).
Move QueryableDefaults functionality (static methods) into QueryableRecorder (implements QueryableFactory interface). Obsolete Replayer interface.

Translate Queryable to RelNode by implementing a QueryableBuilder. We can now plan a query with a filter.

Make RelDataType and related types implement linq4j's RecordType. Mixing the eigenbase type system with the java type system is experimental; I don't know whether it will pan out.

Rename Field to RecordField and getFields to getRecordFields, to prevent clashes with java.lang.reflect.Field and RelDataType.

Add QueryableFactory, to encapsulate behavior to build trees of Queryables. (Still need to provide a default implementation of this factory, which will replace the 'todo' methods in QueryableDefaults. And some of the methods that currently return scalar types like 'float' will return Queryable or something similar.)

Remove from ExtendedQueryable interface methods that are already defined in ExtendedEnumerable.

Break Extensions into QueryableDefaults and EnumerableDefaults. Add OpType and OpQueryable.

Move QueryProviderImpl.executeQuery(QueryableImpl) up to become QueryProvider.executeQuery(Queryable).
Re-organize directory structure; add package-info files; move EigenbaseResource.properties into resource directory, as maven demands.
Type utilities.
Working again after re-org.
Progress check-in. It now builds, but doesn't run.
Progress check-in.
Rename Member to Table, TableFunction. Schema is now a DataContext, and JdbcSchema obsoletes JdbcDataContext.
Fix package-infos.
Start on the real SQL provider. The goal is to execute JDBC queries by pushing as much logic as possible into a SQL query.
Add class QueryProviderImpl.

Some more SQL operators against JDBC backend (JOIN, distinct-COUNT, ORDER BY, empty GROUP BY; but all still implemented in linq4j); composite GROUP BY keys; SQL DECIMAL type mapped into BigDecimal in Java.
Implement toLookup with EqualityComparer, orderByDescending, reverse.

More operations working against JDBC provider. Operations are still implemented in the client (using linq4j builtins).

Add DataContext, and move some data/functionality that used to be in "root" into it.
Generate class constants (e.g. "String.class") in the same way as literals.

Beginnings of a JDBC QueryProvider.

Cleanup of concepts related to Schema. Rename Function to Member, and obsolete SchemaObject and Overload.

Schemas and members no longer need to remember their own name and ancestry. The container does that.

Move 'wasNull' field from Getter and into AbstractCursor. Getters are non-static, so they can reference it implicitly.
Re-order QueryProvider args, and provide default QueryProvider. Test Enumerable.union() and .except().
Add Enumerable.into(), and implement Enumerable.except() and .intersect().
Implement SQL INTERSECT, EXCEPT and Substring; optimize records that have a single field.
Union & concat almost work, except for a bug in the cursor.
BlockBuilder renames duplicate variables.
Visitor is now complete.
Fix CheapestPlanReplacer to not mutate RelNodes.
Introduce Visitor for expressions (not complete; still compile errors).
Implement UNION. (Queries can plan but currently run into a bug while implementing them.)
Implement ORDER BY.
Add class BlockBuilder, that ensures hygienic variable names.
Implement Enumerable.orderBy.
GROUP BY is now working.

Introduce base class, Node, of Expression, and sibling class Statement. Special logic for blocks, since in a lambda function we quite often want to convert an expression to a block "{ return expression; }".

BlockExpression, LoopExpression, WhileExpression, GotoExpression are misleadingly named, for now.

 Implement aggregate, sum, average, min, max on Enumerable.

Support for GROUP BY. Add rule and rel for aggregation implemented by generating code that implements Enumerable. (Not fully working.)

Match changes to linq4j for array-access.
Fix for API changes in janino-2.6.1.

Remove support for multi-dimensional arrays. (Java arrays are one-dimensional.)

Add toList method to convert arrays (especially varargs) into lists.
Re-organize schema structure. Upgrade janino. Queries that return an Object[] (i.e. not a struct) now work.

Acknowledge source of lambda APIs.
New packages net.hydromatic.lambda based on prototype APIs in the OpenJDK lambda project. Not used by the rest of linq4j at present, but this API is a candidate to replace Enumerable in future.
Improve code generation of inner class names and arrays.
More type information. Add maps from Java to SQL functions in both directions, including String.toUpperCase()/UPPER.
More improvements to expressions.

Implement QueryProvider. Can now create a Queryable, extend it using where, select etc. methods, and implement via a planner.

Use java.lang.reflect.Type rather than java.lang.Class for type information; this allows caller to provide alternative implementation with generic parameters, if more extra information is required.

Refactor type-related utility methods into Types.
Re-organize directory structure; add package-info files; move EigenbaseResource.properties into resource directory, as maven demands.
Factor out Cursor from OptiqResultSet; will allow a result set to work on top of various iterator protocols.

Expand QueryProvider interface.

Improve Java expression model and code-generation: lambdas, static methods, array initializers. Also, add headers to package-info files.

Fill out the preparation/planning process. Relational operations that implement EnumerableRel can write themselves out as an expression, which Janino can then compile.

Add ExpressionWriter, so that expressions can write themselves out as Java source code.
